channel.title: Computer Paul Sessions
channel.description: Seattle-NYC based house-soul-downtempo producer Computer Paul shares his favorite tracks. Underground hip-hop, dancehall, salsa, reggae, house, downtempo, disco, funk.
channel.itunes:subtitle: Get your fill of deep soul funk vibes
channel.itunes:author: Computer Paul
channel.itunes:summary: Seattle-NYC based house-soul-downtempo producer Computer Paul shares his favorite tracks. Underground hip-hop, dancehall, salsa, reggae, house, downtempo, disco, funk.

item.title: Episode 16
item.description:
This is the true sound of Computer Paul. Brand new avant UK beats, classic house and deep house, funky techno, all in the blend. My first mix done with the NI Kontrol S4.

1. Crack Is Whack (The Kings Arms Remix) 6:53 Lati Street Disco EP

2. Parallel Perc (Original Mix) 7:26 Jay Shepheard & Tad Wily Retrofit  3

3. Bock 4:53 Meati & Meech Bock

4. Soul Walkin (Original Mix) 6:42 Catchymunki Year 1

5. A Thing Called Love (Kink Dub) 7:06 Wolfram Feat Haddaway A Thing Called Love

6. The Moment (Original Mix) 6:17 Frederico Todos The Moment EP

7. No Idea 1987 Mix 5:47 Kolombo LouLou Records Presents LouLou Players Ibiza Music Summit Compilation

8. Easy 5:32 Seiji Seiji 4

9. Behaving Badly (Nightriders Dub Mix) 5:02 Magnifik Behaving Badly Remix EP

10. Dub Potion 4:53 The Rhythm Odyssey Love Potion

11. Into You  (French Fries Remix) 4:30 Greenmoney Into You

12. Shed My Soul Negghead Remix 7:18 KÂ´Bonus Shed My Soul EP

13. Blue Vaudeville (Shonky Rmx) 6:51 Alex Celler Blue Vaudeville EP

14. Tonight (Sneakbeats Dub) 7:51 H-Foundation Tonight Remixes

15. Almost Invisible 7:24 Leif Liebedetail 38

16. So Good (Hanssen Remix) 6:02 Ian Pooley So Good

17. Get Lady (Original) 6:40 JeanGuillaume Cabanne Aqua Paella EP

18. It Keeps You Movin' (Original Mix) 10:13 Peter Horrevorts And Van Anh It Keeps You Movin'  Single

19. This Is Pachamama (Horatio Remix) 7:47 Melohman This Is Pachamama

20. Lo Pan Trickski Remix 5:56 Deep Space Orchestra Lo Pan Special Edition

item.title: Episode 11
item.description:
Al B and I DJ'd together for many years in NYC.  Enjoy this mix.

Tracklisting:

Linkwood - Fudge Boogie
Toby Tobias - In Your Eyes (Tensnake remix)
Atmofear - Dancing In Outer Space (The Revenge Rework 2)
Tom Demac - In Your Eyes (Wolf and Lamb remix)
Art of Tones - Call the Shots (Motor City Drum Ensemble remix)
Tensnake - Can You Feel It
Best Mate - Situation Go Bang (Spank remix)
Populette - Mommy
Deetron - Dark Matter
Test 1 - Original Mix
Tensnake vs Suite 9 - Dust
Kurd Maverick - Let's Work (Jimpster remix)
JC Freaks and The Revenge - Dub Praise (The Revenge rework)
Tom Trago - Passion (Motor City Drum Ensemble remix)
Joris Voorn - Blank (Deetron Paradise dub)
Fiori Dixon - Ame (Beat edit)
Franc Spangler - Forever and a Dub
MANIK - Aftermath (Rick Wade remix)

item.title: Episode 9
item.description: After a long and crazy absence, Computer Paul returns with another mix of classic disco, clunky eclectic house, and a bit of tech. Enjoy!
item.dc:creator: Computer Paul
item.itunes:summary: After a long and crazy absence, Computer Paul returns with another mix of classic disco, clunky eclectic house, and a bit of tech. Enjoy!

item.title: Episode 7
item.description: Welcome to another session! A serious mix of disco old and new, along with some gritty conga-laden deep techy house... and into some straight up fun time bangers! Happy 2010.
item.dc:creator: Computer Paul
item.itunes:summary: Welcome to another session! A serious mix of disco old and new, along with some gritty conga-laden deep techy house... and into some straight up fun time bangers! Happy 2010.

item.title: Episode 6
item.description:
Happy Thanksgiving to all the American listeners out there!  I've recently discovered that the Chicago House sound is alive and kickin', with great new artists like Bryan Jones (http://www.djbryanjones.com/) keeping the flame burning, with his wonderland of beats sounding like the lovechild of Todd Edwards and Derrick Carter.  This is also the first mix I've released that was done entirely with the VCI-100 SE (shouts to djtechtools.com), so apologies if the filter madness gets a little much.  I think I'm still trying to prove that controllerism is real DJ'ing ;).  Regardless the sound here is the psychedelic Computer Paul sound you should expect, with some pretty out there Nu Disco cuts thrown in to spice up the groove.  I can't remember the exact track listing in order, but I think these are the tracks:

b.d.i. - Brooklyn to LA (Simbad Re-edit)

Trevor Loveys - Turn It Up

Flap
item.dc:creator: Computer Paul
item.itunes:summary: Happy Thanksgiving to all the American listeners out there!  I've recently discovered that the Chicago House sound is alive and kickin', with great new artists like Bryan Jones (http://www.djbryanjones.com/) keeping the flame burning, with his wonderland of beats sounding like the lovechild of Todd Edwards and Derrick Carter.  This is also the first mix I've released that was done entirely with the VCI-100 SE (shouts to djtechtools.com), so apologies if the filter madness gets a little much.  I think I'm still trying to prove that controllerism is real DJ'ing ;).  Regardless the sound here is the psychedelic Computer Paul sound you should expect, with some pretty out there Nu Disco cuts thrown in to spice up the groove.  I can't remember the exact track listing in order, but I think these are the tracks:b.d.i. - Brooklyn to LA (Simbad Re-edit) Trevor Loveys - Turn It Up Flap

item.title: Computer Paul Podcast 5
item.description: This mix is all about a late night drive on a dark highway with just your headlights showing the way. Or late night 4am cruising on the boulevard. This is a darker mix of mostly "nu disco" style tracks, slowly building up into a deep tech house kind of vibe. Stay tuned if you like the lighter stuff, next month will be a mostly old school disco session. Send feedback to basscakes at gmail.com! Thanks for listening and thanks for your support around the world!
item.dc:creator: Computer Paul
item.itunes:summary: This mix is all about a late night drive on a dark highway with just your headlights showing the way. Or late night 4am cruising on the boulevard. This is a darker mix of mostly "nu disco" style tracks, slowly building up into a deep tech house kind of vibe. Stay tuned if you like the lighter stuff, next month will be a mostly old school disco session. Send feedback to basscakes at gmail.com! Thanks for listening and thanks for your support around the world!

item.title: Computer Paul Podcast Episode 4
item.description: This time I really wanted to make something unconventional, so I pulled out all the stops and created this crazy mish-mash of disco, house, funk, raregroove, breaks, electro, and techno. It attempts to capture the variety of great styles of music old and new that I love, and harkens back to the old Freeskool days. I've been tweaking my MIDI controller settings as well for more psychotic effects, which clearly have the potential to get a little crazy at times. Enjoy!
item.dc:creator: Computer Paul
item.itunes:summary: This time I really wanted to make something unconventional, so I pulled out all the stops and created this crazy mish-mash of disco, house, funk, raregroove, breaks, electro, and techno. It attempts to capture the variety of great styles of music old and new that I love, and harkens back to the old Freeskool days. I've been tweaking my MIDI controller settings as well for more psychotic effects, which clearly have the potential to get a little crazy at times. Enjoy!

item.title: Computer Paul Disco Edit Podcast (#3)
item.description: I upgraded to Traktor Pro and ripped out this mix. So many options, so many buttons to push! Also less talking this time, more music. Definitely more of a clubby mix, but features a 50/50 blend of contemporary disco edits and classic disco edits, along with a few house beats underneath to keep the bass levels pumping. Enjoy!
item.dc:creator: Computer Paul
item.itunes:summary: I upgraded to Traktor Pro and ripped out this mix. So many options, so many buttons to push! Also less talking this time, more music. Definitely more of a clubby mix, but features a 50/50 blend of contemporary disco edits and classic disco edits, along with a few house beats underneath to keep the bass levels pumping. Enjoy!

item.title: Computer Paul Podcast #2
item.description: Live in the mix with Traktor DJ! This mix is completely live with no edits or other tomfoolery. A nice selection of disco, disco edits, some live on the fly disco edits!, house, and some breaks. Ask for tracklisting.
item.dc:creator: Computer Paul
item.itunes:summary: Live in the mix with Traktor DJ! This mix is completely live with no edits or other tomfoolery. A nice selection of disco, disco edits, some live on the fly disco edits!, house, and some breaks. Ask for tracklisting.
